  "Allegations" : "FLORIDA RESIDENT HAS WRITTEN TO THE STATE REGULATOR THAT FA RECOMMENDED HE LIQUIDATE ANNUITY, PURCHASED AT ANOTHER FIRM, TO INVEST IN A MUTUAL FUND PORTFOLIO 6/26/08.  HE CLAIMS THAT FA TOLD HIM HE WOULD BE BETTER OFF IN THE MUTUAL FUND PORTFOLIO.  CLIENT FEELS HE WAS MISLED AND WANTS TO BE MADE WHOLE ON LOSSES IN THE MUTUAL FUND PORTFOLIO, WHICH TOTAL $59,991.14. ***ARBITRATION ALLEGATIONS: CLAIMANT, A FLORIDA RESIDENT, ALLEGES FA NEGLIGENTLY RECOMMENDED THAT HE SELL A VARIABLE ANNUITY AND INVEST THE PROCEEDS IN EQUITY POSITIONS. CLAIMANT SOUGHT COMPENSATORY DAMAGES IN AN AMOUNT TO BE DETERMINED, BUT BELIEVED TO BE OVER $5,000. DATES OF ACTIVITY NOT SPECIFIED.",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$25,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "WITHOUT ADMITTING ANY LIABILITY, THE FIRM SETTLED THE MATTER FOR $25,000.00.  [CUSTOMER] MADE THE DECISION TO SURRENDER THE ANNUITY AFTER CAREFULLY REVIEWING THE COSTS AND OPTIONS. HE WAS DISSATISFIED WITH THE PERFORMANCE OF THE ANNUITY AND WANTED OTHER INVESTMENT OPTIONS, SUCH AS GOLD AND OIL, WHICH WEREN'T AVAILABLE IN THE SEPARATE ACCOUNTS OF THE ANNUITY. HE CLAIMED I CONVINCED HIM TO DO THIS TO EARN HIGH COMMISSIONS, YET HIS ACCOUNT WAS FEE-BASED WITH NO COMMISSIONS PAYABLE ON ANY TRANSACTIONS."
}
